titleStmt.title: Speech notes by Eartha M. M. White. No date given.
titleStmt.author: Eartha M. M. White

respStmt.name: Lydia P. Stewart and Janaya Ferrer

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: The author writes notes for a speech.

objectDesc.p: A handwritten note written on a single sheet of lined paper with a tear on the top-left corner.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

p.hi:
Masters of Ceremonyceremony, Ladiesladies, Gentlemengentlemen,
and Membersmembers of the City Federation -
at this moment.

body.p:
I must admit that I am completely
lost for words to express my appreciation.
ifIf Everever I felt the need of something
to say it is now.

These surprises has been showered upon
me so fast that I have not had time
to think of what to say. restRest assured,
Howeverhowever, I appreciate and accept
Eacheach of these gifts in the same
sweet spririt in which they were
Presentedpresented.

andAnd if I have done any little thing
at all to merit them, I feel
truly grateful to those that have
assisted me in doing so.
My only regret is that I have not
been able to do more.
Let Eacheach of us remember -
Some ships sail East and some sail West
Byby the self same winds that blow:
Tis the set of the sails, and not the gates,
that determines which way they go.
Like the winds of the East are the forces
of fate, as we travel along through
life: Tis the set of the soul that
determines the goal, and not the
calm or strife.
